alert.note: Alert for Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 9:21PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN WRIGHT COUNTY THROUGH 945 PM CDT... At 921 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Howard Lake, or 11 miles southwest of Buffalo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Rockford, Montrose, Cokato, Maple Lake, Howard Lake, Waverly, Silver Creek, Buffalo Airport, Rassat, Smith Lake, and Lake Maria State Park. This includes U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 118 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
